snippet: The magazine’s story claiming to have uncovered the founder of the digital currency drew a wave of attention, much of it negative.
abstract: Newsweek's return to newsstands, after being out of print for 14 months, features explosive claim that it had uncovered mysterious founder of digital currency Bitcoin; story draws wave of attention, much of it negative, as Dorian Satoshi Nakamoto, reclusive train collector from California and man Newsweek identifies as Bitcoin’s founder, gives two-hour interview to The Associated Press saying story is wrong.

byline.original: By LESLIE KAUFMAN and NOAM COHEN

lead_paragraph: The magazine’s story claiming to have uncovered the founder of the digital currency drew a wave of attention, much of it negative.

headline.main: Newsweek Returns to Print and Sets Off a Bitcoin Storm
headline.print_headline: Newsweek Returns to Print and Sets Off a Bitcoin Storm
